attributes.action: Provide support for aspiring drinking establishments entrepreneurs
attributes.additional_details: There has been an ongoing struggle over the last two decades regarding the inability of private businesses to thrive in the British economy. A substantial portion of British drinking establishments has either declared bankruptcy or silently stopped operations. We believe that there has been more boundaries than support, causing widespread vexation. Companies like BBPA has echoed this sentiment.
attributes.background: We request that aspiring entrepreneurs wanting to get involved in the drinking industry have access to professional support, intended on revitalising and providing more avenues to the  industry.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what kind of support you would like the Government or Parliament to provide to aspiring entrepreneurs in the drinks industry.

Additionally, your petition is about a devolved matter and would only apply to England.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: https://petitions.parliament.scot/
